When I was 5-6years old I barely ate and especially almost rarely drank. I didn't actually like food except fruit then sometime later my mom started making grill cheese sandwiches with meat on them so I ate those at least 3-2 times a week(one sandwich per day), the only ACTUAL, food I ate. I think I only did this with the grill cheese sandwich for a month then I got tired of eating. I was never underweight, but I was skinny. I think all my water came from my fruit since I used to always have them rinsed off like your supposed to. I ate strawberries, every once in a while apple, canned fruit cocktail, and I think canned peaches, but mainly fruit cocktail. I would sometimes lick some of the juice from it. I only ate fruit every 2-3 days. I didn't really like drinking juice, but I liked it, but barely drank it. I preferred water since it was light and it didn't feel all heavy with junk. My mom just gave up on trying to convince me to eat the food she cook, well I guess had (if she even cooked; didn't feel like she did). The reason I didn't eat was one my mom couldn't cook and two I didn't like eating food mainly because of her. The only good food she made was grilled cheese sandwiches with meat. Btw I sat outside everyday from like 6am-10pm playing with worms. I never felt dehydrated, but went I did i was just a little thirsty and didn't feel like getting up (I also didn't know where the cups or even where to get the water beside the bathroom sink since I didn't actually associate myself with the kitchen). A few minutes later I wasn't thirsty anymore, got all my energy back, and felt like as if I just took a few sips of water which I didn't. I would go a few days without drinking and when I did drink I just took half a mouth wash cap full of water. If I ate fruit it would be sometimes the whole can which I ate once a day. I was very energetic, healthy, and had no problems at all. Later in life I tried to start drinking more water. I usually drink like between half to a full bottle of water a day. My body can't take much water because it's not used to it and if you don't believe me hear this. If I tried to drink 2 water bottles full of water within 2 hours I would have to go to the bathroom all day literally every 20 mins. I literally pissed out all water. It just shock straight out me like a violently, high pressure gyster the second I got my pants off literally just water (I know too much detail). It was clearer than the toilet water. I felt my body draining out all the water it just consumed. This would go on for the next few days which decreased to 30-40mins. This happened a few years ago. I tried again like 2 years ago, but drank less water within a hour and went every 25mins for a few hours. Now my body can with stand more, but if I drink like 3 water bottles within 20mins I will be running to the bathroom constantly for days. I'm healthy today too with lots of leg muscle, btw I'm a 17year old girl

Great video. However thirst is NOT the only way your brain tells you that your body needs water and it isn't even the first. The way your brain looks at the situation, saliva is a much needed biological function as it aids in swallowing, digesting food that you eat and cleansing your mouth. The brain must be bathed lavishly in cerebral fluid and is constantly robbing other less important areas of your body for water. Loss of water means, via osmotic pull, histamine [in the cell] goes up.  The local increase of histamine is, over time, manifested in things such as; asthma, allergies, major joint pains,  heartburn, back pain, migraine headaches.  In other words, If your thirsty your either STONED, or already CHRONICALLY DEHYDRATED. Your body can roll with this condition so long as NOTHING ELSE happens to you (ie you don't get sick, don't run etc.). Instead of taking pills for that discomfort you feel, next time drink 2 glasses of water and see how that treats you.

Water is not a renewable natural resource.  The water we drink today is the same water the dinosaurs drank millions of years ago.  It's true.  Turning on the faucet in this country and expecting clean potable water is not going to last forever.  People in this world wake up every morning to walk very far just to fill up water jugs to keep hydrated for a day.  The more we propagate the scarcer water will become and wars are being fought over liquid assets and access to drinking water, aquifers, and clear water streams which are few and far between.  Desalinization is not the answer either since it cannot keep up with demand and is highly expensive.  Just ask Saudi Arabia.  And now,  look at California.  They are already feeling the effects of high agricultural demand and lack of fresh water supply,  running faucets with mud instead of clean water.  We all are not immune from this.  If we all would even flush our toilets(which dump 5 gallons or more a shot)every other bladder dump, it would save billions of gallons a day.  If we didn't run the water while we brushed our teeth, the same would be achieved. Be mindful of your water use.  You will appreciate it the next time you are thirsty, which is when your body says, unless you drink, you will suffer a horrific and unbearable demise. Sorry, but eventually true.  This isn't an advertisement, just a non-tree hugging concerned citizen.

This doesn't mean I recommend trying to survive without drinking fluids for weeks. Just that your body can still use the fluids in solid foods.
